commit.title: [boot] Don't initialize coqlib when `-boot` is passed.
commit.message:
[boot] Don't initialize coqlib when `-boot` is passed.

We refactor handling of `-boot` so the "coqlib" guessing routine,
`Envars.coqlib ()` is not called when bootstrapping.

This is not very interesting in compositional builds as the heuristics
to locate the prelude will fail due to different build layout choices;
so it is our goal to have Coq do no guessing when `-boot` is passed,
leaving the location of libraries to the usual command line
parameters.

Ideally, we would remove `Envars.coqlib` altogether, as we want to
avoid clients accessing the Coq filesystem in a non-controlled way,
but this will do for now.

to locate the prelude will fail due to different build layout choices;
so it is our goal to have Coq do no guessing when `-boot` is passed,
leaving the location of libraries to the usual command line
parameters.

Ideally, we would remove `Envars.coqlib` altogether, as we want to
avoid clients accessing the Coq filesystem in a non-controlled way,
but this will do for now.
